txt.en:
'There is much work to do. We know that the Enemy has begun to mobilize and march in several different regions of Middle-earth, but we have yet to glean their targets. Without knowing where they are going, we cannot adequately prepare defences and ensure the people will be safe.

'I need you to go out and hunt down anything that may have orders. Orcs, goblins, trolls, uruks, Warg-riders, anything that would be entrusted with plans. It matters not where they are, hunt them in Forochel, Eregion, Bree, Mirkwood, Angmar, anywhere. These orders are important enough that all of the Enemy will have them.

'Once you have collected several of them you will need to find a target list. Bring them all back to any Skirmish Captain. We will decipher the orders, compare then against the target list, then send you off to either prepare the defences or reclaim what they have already taken.'

<rgb=#FF0000>War orders will only drop off of monsters that do not appear grey to your character; they must be around the same level as you </rgb>

<rgb=#FF0000>War orders will only drop off of monsters that do not appear grey to your character; they must be around the same level as you </rgb>

War-orders can be found on Orcs, uruks, goblins, trolls, Warg-riders, and more throughout all of Middle-earth.

In order to discover where the Enemy plans on striking, the Skirmish Captains need to study some of the war-orders that have been issued to the Enemy's forces.

<rgb=#FF0000>War orders will only drop off of monsters that do not appear grey to your character; they must be around the same level as you </rgb>

Return the War Orders and Target List to a Skirmish Captain in any of the Skirmish Camps.\n\nSkirmish camps are at Bree's South Gate, Thorin's Hall, Esteldin, Nimrodel, the Twenty-first Hall, Ost Guruth, Rivendell, Michel Delving, Tinnudir, Suri Kyla, Aughaire and Gwingris.

'You have returned with the orders? I trust you found enough that we may be able to glean their intentions from them.\n\n'This confirms the message we just received from Bree. I hope you are prepared, [placeholder].'
While the Free Peoples know the Enemy is on the march, where they are marching to has yet to be discovered.
